children.name: High level Language Use
children.description: A set of HLL syntaxes and semantics to enable writing Algorand Smart Contracts.

children.name: High level Language Use Native Syntax
children.description: Each HLL definition should use as much native syntax as possibile while keeping the number of new concepts, types, and idioms to a minimum.

children.name: Clear definition of native High Level Language Syntax
children.description: Must define exactly what subset of the native HLL is available and the restriction when it is.

children.name: Smart Contract Compilation
children.description: Has the ability to compile Algorand Python code into AVM (Algorand Virtual Machine) bytecode for execution on the Algorand blockchain

children.name: Modular Design
children.description: The components of the compiler should have a modular design that enables extensibility and code reuse, facilitating future enhancements and support for new languages or platforms

children.name: Frontend
children.description: Has the ability to compile code from an AlgoKit-support language to Intermediate Representation of the code

children.name: Support Languages
children.description: Must have the ability to support multiple languages in which users will write smart contracts. These languages must be as semantically close as possible to the original languages

children.name: Python
children.description: Must support the Python language

children.name: Typescript
children.description: Must support the Typescript Language

children.name: Multi-stage optimization
children.description: Must support applying multiple optimization passes at different IR stages that allow for more specialized and effective optimizations. The end result should be TEAL Intermediate Representation

children.name: Optimization Parameters
children.description: Must be able to optimize the code based on the following parameters

children.name: opcode budget
children.description: Must be able to optimize the code for opcode budget

children.name: code size
children.description: Must be able to optimize the code for code size

children.name: Output
children.description: The compiler should be able to turn TEAL Intermediate Representation to various target languages and output various files generated from the TEAL.

children.name: Artifacts
children.description: The compiler should generate various output artifacts, including:

children.name: TEAL code
children.description: The compiler should output TEAL code

children.name: AVM bytecode
children.description: The compiler should output AVM bytecode

children.name: ARC-32 application specification file
children.description: The compiler should output ARC-32 application specification files (for ARC-4 contracts)

children.name: ARC-56 application specification file
children.description: The compiler should output ARC-56 application specification files (for ARC-4 contracts)

children.name: Source Maps
children.description: Must be able to produce debugging symbols and source maps.

children.name: AVM Target Version
children.description: Must be able to target all versions of the AVM.

children.name: Data Types
children.description: Uses a typing system for the particular language that that provide a statically typed representation of the behaviour that is possible on the Algorand Virtual Machine

children.name: Template Variables
children.description: Must provide a way to define template variables that are placeholders for a deploy-time provided value. They allow developers to define placeholders in their Algorand Python smart contract code that can be replaced with specific literal values during the compilation process.

children.name: Address
children.description: Must have support for Address: An alias for an array containing 32 bytes representing an Algorand address

children.name: BigUFixedNxM
children.description: Must have support for BigUFixedNxM: An ARC4 UFixed representing a decimal with the number of bits and precision specified.

children.name: BigUIntN
children.description: Must have support for BigUIntN: An ARC4 UInt consisting of the number of bits specified.

children.name: Bool
children.description: Must have support for Bool: An ARC4 encoded bool

children.name: Bytes
children.description: Must have support for Bytes: An ARC4 alias for a UInt8

children.name: DynamicArray
children.description: Must have support for DynamicArray: A dynamically sized ARC4 Array of the specified type

children.name: DynamicBytes
children.description: Must have support for DynamicBytes: A variable sized array of bytes

children.name: StaticArray
children.description: Must have support for StaticArray: A fixed length ARC4 Array of the specified type and length

children.name: String
children.description: Must have support for String: An ARC4 sequence of bytes containing a UTF8 string

children.name: Struct
children.description: Must have support for Struct: Base class for ARC4 Struct types

children.name: Tuple
children.description: Must have support for Tuple: An ARC4 ABI tuple, containing other ARC4 ABI types

children.name: UFixedNxM
children.description: Must have support for UFixedNxM: An ARC4 UFixed representing a decimal with the number of bits and precision specified.

children.name: UIntN
children.description: Must have support for UIntN: An ARC4 UInt consisting of the number of bits specified.

children.name: Data Storage
children.description: Must have ways to store data within your smart contracts, both persistently and temporarily and various access types

children.name: Global Storage
children.description: Must allow for data that global available to the contract that needs to be accessible across multiple calls to the contract and should persist throughout the contract's lifetime

children.name: Local Storage
children.description: Must allow for storing data specific to individual accounts that interact with your contract

children.name: Box Storage
children.description: Must allow for data globally available to the contract that is more flexible and potentially larger data storage

children.name: Box
children.description: Must be able to store single values

children.name: BoxMap
children.description: Must be able to organizing multiple boxes (e.g. key-value store)

children.name: BoxRef
children.description: Must allow for working with large byte arrays in boxes, offering efficient methods for reading and updating portions of the data.

children.name: Raw AVM Ops
children.description: Allow for fine-grained control to interact with box storage directly using the AVM operations

children.name: Scratch Space
children.description: Must allow for temporary storage that's only available during a single execution of your contract's approval or clear-state program

children.name: Transactions
children.description: Must allow working with various types of transactions within your smart contracts

children.name: Group Transactions
children.description: Must provide a way to create group transactions such that transactions can be grouped together atomically, ensuring that either all transactions in a group succeed or none of them do

children.name: Group transactions by index
children.description: Must be able to group transactions by assigning an index to them

children.name: Inner Transactions
children.description: Must provide a structured way to define, submit, and manage inner transactions.

children.name: Submit inner transaction individually
children.description: Must be able to submit inner transactions individually

children.name: Submit inner transaction as a group
children.description: Must be able to submit inner transactions as a group

children.name: Access inner transactions results
children.description: Must be able to access inner transactions logs after the operation is complete

children.name: Subroutines
children.description: Must allow for subroutines that are internal or private methods to a contract

children.name: Subroutine accessibility
children.description: Subroutines must be able to exist as part of a contract class, or at the module level so they can be used by multiple classes or even across multiple projects.

children.name: Logging
children.description: Allow emitting debugging and event information as well as return values from your contracts to the caller.

children.name: Logging various Data Types
children.description: Allow logging the following data types:

children.name: int
children.description: Allow logging int literals / module variables (encoded as raw bytes, not ASCII)

children.name: UInt64
children.description: Allow logging UInt64 values (encoded as raw bytes, not ASCII)

children.name: str
children.description: Allow logging str literals / module variables (encoded as UTF-8)

children.name: bytes literals
children.description: Allow logging bytes literals / module variables (encoded as is)

children.name: Bytes values
children.description: Allow logging Bytes values (encoded as is)

children.name: BytesBacked
children.description: Allow logging BytesBacked values, which includes String, BigUInt, Account and all of the ARC-4 types (encoded as their underlying bytes values)

children.name: Log single value
children.description: Allow logging a single value

children.name: Log multiple values
children.description: Allow logging mulitple values

children.name: ARC-28 Event Logs
children.description: Allow for logging ARC-28 events according to the ARC-28 specification

children.name: Error Handling
children.description: Allow for handling errors on execution of a smart contract

children.name: Assertions
children.description: Allow for addition of assertions to a smart contract that will immediately fail the execution if the statement evaluate to false

children.name: Assertion Error Message
children.description: Allow for a string error message added to the assertion that will be added as a TEAL comment if the assertion fails. The error should show a TEAL stack trace of an error and thus show the error message to the caller (when source maps have been loaded)

children.name: Explicit Failures
children.description: Allow to fail the contract explicitly. This operation should cause the TEAL program to immediately and unconditionally fail.

children.name: Debugging
children.description: NEED MORE DETAIL HERE

children.name: Contract Auditing
children.description: NEED MORE DETAIL HERE

children.name: Development Environment
children.description: Provide a streamlined development experience with tools for testing, debugging, and deploying contracts.

children.name: Intellisense
children.description: Code completion and suggestions within your editor.

children.name: Linting
children.description: Static analysis to identify potential code style and quality issues.

children.name: Formatting
children.description: Automatic code style enforcement to maintain consistency.

children.name: Debugging
children.description: Tools for setting breakpoints and stepping through code execution.

children.name: Deployment
children.description: Simplified processes for deploying contracts to the Algorand network.

children.name: CI/CD
children.description: Integration with continuous integration and continuous delivery pipelines.

children.name: Component Generation
children.description: Generated components that facilitate Smart Contract interactions for specific applications.

children.name: ARC Compliance
children.description: Should be based on ARCs that define the interface and the properties of a SC.

children.name: Type Safety
children.description: Must offer type safe functions compatible with SC types.

children.name: State Management
children.description: Global/Local state reading.

children.name: Method Interaction
children.description: Method calls.

children.name: Box Data Access
children.description: Box reading.

children.name: Resource Management
children.description: Must know how to populate external resources.

children.name: Language Independence
children.description: Must be SC HLL agnostic.

children.name: Multi-Language Support
children.description: Should be available in all supported languages.

children.name: Transaction Group Handling
children.description: Must know how to compile argument transactions into a transaction group.

children.name: Component Generation
children.description: Generated components that facilitate Smart Contract interactions for specific applications.

children.name: ARC Compliance
children.description: Should be based on ARCs that define the interface and the properties of a SC.

children.name: Type Safety
children.description: Must offer type safe functions compatible with SC types.

children.name: State Management
children.description: Global/Local state reading.

children.name: Method Interaction
children.description: Method calls.

children.name: Box Data Access
children.description: Box reading.

children.name: Resource Management
children.description: Must know how to populate external resources.

children.name: Language Independence
children.description: Must be SC HLL agnostic.

children.name: Multi-Language Support
children.description: Should be available in all supported languages.

children.name: Transaction Group Handling
children.description: Must know how to compile argument transactions into a transaction group.

children.name: Algokit Templates
children.description: Scaffolding for an AlgoKit-first project.

children.name: Template Definition
children.description: Definition of a parameterizable and reusable templates

children.name: Create project scaffold
children.description: The ability to create a project directory structure that conforms the best practices of AlgoKit-first project

children.name: Standard project structure
children.description: Define a standard project structure and strategy to, optionally, deploy a compiled smart contract.

children.name: Integrate with visual debugging VSCode
children.description: Must integrate with VSCode visual debugging tools.

children.name: Integrate visual debugging PyCharm
children.description: Must integrate with PyCharm visual debugging tools.

children.name: Support all smart contract languages
children.description: Smart contract template must support all supported languages.

children.name: Support versioning
children.description: Must integrate with git.

children.name: Mutli-contract deployment
children.description: The deployment strategy shall be able to orchestrate a complex multi-contract deployment in addition to a single-contract deployment.

children.name: Create templating parameters
children.description: The project should contain parameters that the user can set when the template is being initialized

children.name: Creating project dependencies
children.description: Project dependencies should be able to be set and upgraded for each template

children.name: Pinning LocalNet version
children.description: A template must define the acceptable range of versions compatible with that project.

children.name: Template upgradeability
children.description: There should exist a path to migration in case a template is re-rendered on top of an existing project.

children.name: Initializing the project from the command line
children.description: The ability to run a command and create a new algokit project

children.name: Generating the project through a guided wizard
children.description: Allow the user to set the parameters for the given project through a wizard cli with prompts and options

children.name: Generating the project through command line arguments
children.description: Allow the user to set the paramaters through command line arguments with defaults for the arguments not specifiied

children.name: Starter Template
children.description: Must have at least a lean, beginner friendly, and non-overwhelming variant.

children.name: Smart Contract Language
children.description: Have the ability to choose a language in which to develop smart contracts

children.name: Python
children.description: The template structure and dependencies to develop smart contracts in python

children.name: Typescript
children.description: The template structure and dependencies to develop smart contracts in typescript

children.name: React Frontend
children.description: DESCRIBE WHAT THE BASIC REACT TEMPLATE HAS HERE

children.name: Wallet aggregators integration
children.description: Must integrate with Algorand wallet aggregators.

children.name: Production Template
children.description: Must have a full featured, complete, and comprehensive production ready variant.

children.name: Smart Contract Language
children.description: Have the ability to choose a language in which to develop smart contracts

children.name: Python
children.description: The template structure and dependencies to develop smart contracts in python

children.name: Typescript
children.description: The template structure and dependencies to develop smart contracts in typescript

children.name: React Frontend
children.description: DESCRIBE WHAT THE PRODUCTION REACT TEMPLATE HAS HERE

children.name: Smart Contract CI-CD
children.description: Must provide CI-CD pipelines using GitHub workflows and virtualized task runners. These pipelines must be: compatible with output stability checks, cheap in terms of compute minutes, dependency environment and artifact cache friendly, and finally parametrizable at least in terms of Algorand API provider and target network.

children.name: Frontend CI-CD
children.description: Must provide CI-CD pipelines using GitHub workflows and virtualized task runners. These pipelines should: be compatible with Vercel and Netlify deployments using API tokens, implement best practices for building a vite project.

children.name: Template variant migration path
children.description: It shall be possible, by use of generators, template re-rendering, or otherwise, to migrate from a beginner template to a production one easily.

children.name: Wallet Creation
children.description: Ability to create a wallet provided a wallet name and password

children.name: Wallet Information
children.description: Get Wallet information

children.name: All Wallets Information
children.description: Get all wallets

children.name: Single Wallet Information
children.description: Fetches and returns wallet information associated with the given wallet name

children.name: Wallet Handle Management
children.description: Manage the wallet handles for accessing information for an associated wallet

children.name: Initialize Wallet Hanlde
children.description: Initializes a handle for the wallet associated with an existing wallet

children.name: Release Wallet Handle
children.description: Deactivates the wallet handle

children.name: Renew Wallet Handle
children.description: Extends the validity of a wallet handle

children.name: Rename Wallet
children.description: Ability to change the name of an existing wallet

children.name: Key Management
children.description: Manages public/private key pair inside a wallet

children.name: List Keys
children.description: Generates a new key pair in the wallet.

children.name: Generate Keys
children.description: Adds an existing private key to a wallet.

children.name: Import Key
children.description: Exports the private key associated with a specific address from

children.name: Export Key
children.description: Deletes a key pair from the wallet.

children.name: Delete Key
children.description: Provides a list of all public keys in a wallet.

children.name: Master Derivation Key
children.description: Exports the master key, enabling wallet

children.name: Rekey Account
children.description: Allow modifying the underlying private key or spending authority.

children.name: Multi Signature Account Management
children.description: Manage multi-signature accounts

children.name: List Mutisignature Account
children.description: Lists all multisig accounts in the wallet.

children.name: Import Mutisignature Account
children.description: Imports a multisig account into the wallet.

children.name: Export Mutisignature Account
children.description: Exports a multisig account from the wallet.

children.name: Delete Mutisignature Account
children.description: Deletes a multisig account from the wallet.

children.name: Transaction Signing
children.description: Allow signing a transactions using a key from the wallet

children.name: Single Signature
children.description: Signs a transaction using a key from a wallet.

children.name: Multisig Signature
children.description: Partially or fully signs a multisig transaction.

children.name: AlgoKit Transaction Type Support
children.description: The AlgoKit utilities should have knowledge of the supported types of Algorand transcations and it should provide type-safe idiomatic interfaces for compiling transactions.

children.name: Transaction Type Abstractions
children.description: The tooling should also provide useful abstraction on top of the transaction type defined by the Algorand Protocol.

children.name: Transaction Field Compatibility
children.description: These abstraction must prevent producing a transaction type with incompatibly set fields.

children.name: Protocol Compliance
children.description: All AlgoKit tooling must be compliant with the same knowledge and abstraction built on top of the transaction type defined by the Algorand Protocol.

children.name: Field Name Standardization
children.description: All AlgoKit tooling must implement these type-safe interfaces using the same field names defined in this document.

children.name: Language-Specific Naming Conventions
children.description: The field names in these interfaces shall be written using the case style idiomatic to the language its being implemented in.

children.name: Protocol Transaction Types
children.description: Algorand Protocol Transaction Types

children.name: Low-Level Type Availability
children.description: All these types must be available as a low-level alternative to abstracted AlgoKit types.

children.name: Module Import Structure
children.description: All these types must be available in all modules as a deeper object in the import hierarchy.

children.name: Import Structure Exceptions
children.description: With the exception of the Payment and Asset Freeze types.

children.name: Payment Transaction Type
children.description: Payment

children.name: Key Registration Transaction Type
children.description: Key Registration

children.name: Asset Configuration Transaction Type
children.description: Asset Configuration

children.name: Asset Freeze Transaction Type
children.description: Asset Freeze

children.name: Freeze Target Field Renaming
children.description: All reference (either direct or indirect) to this transaction type must expose the "FreezeAccount" field renamed as "freezeTarget".

children.name: Asset Transfer Transaction Type
children.description: Asset Transfer

children.name: Asset Receiver Field Renaming
children.description: All reference (either direct or indirect) to this transaction type must expose the "assetReceiver" field renamed as "receiver".

children.name: Asset Sender Field Renaming
children.description: All reference (either direct or indirect) to this transaction type must expose the "assetSender" field renamed as "clawbackTarget".

children.name: Application Call Transaction Type
children.description: Application Call

children.name: State Proof Transaction Type
children.description: State Proof

children.name: AlgoKit Transaction Types
children.description: AlgoKit Abstracted Transaction Types

children.name: Key Registration Types
children.description: Key Registration Abstracted Transaction Types

children.name: Online Key Registration
children.description: Key Registration Online

children.name: Base Transaction Type
children.description: Is based on the Key Registration transaction type.

children.name: Required Fields
children.description: votekey, selkey, votekd, votefst, votelst must all be set.

children.name: Offline Key Registration
children.description: Key Registration Offline

children.name: Base Transaction Type
children.description: Is based on the Key Registration transaction type.

children.name: Field Requirements
children.description: votekey, selkey, votekd, votefst, votelst must all be non-set.

children.name: Asset Transaction Types
children.description: Asset Abstracted Transaction Types

children.name: Clawback Field Restriction
children.description: Unless explicitly state, all these types must not expose the "clawbackTarget" (renamed from asnd / "assetSender") field (when applicable).

children.name: Close Field Restriction
children.description: Unless explicitly state, all these types must not expose the aclose field (when applicable).

children.name: Asset Creation Type
children.description: Asset Creation

children.name: Base Type Definition
children.description: Is based on the Asset Configuration transaction type.

children.name: Field Requirements
children.description: caid must be non-set. apar.t, apar.dc, apar.df must be all set.

children.name: Asset Update Type
children.description: Asset Update

children.name: Base Type Definition
children.description: Is based on the Asset Configuration transaction type.

children.name: Configuration ID Requirement
children.description: caid must be set.

children.name: Address Field Requirements
children.description: Manager, Freeze, Clawback, and Reserve address fields must all be set to either a valid address or a special enum-like (or string literal) value called "ForeverDisabled".

children.name: Asset Deletion Type
children.description: Asset Delete

children.name: Base Type Definition
children.description: Is based on the Asset Configuration transaction type.

children.name: Configuration ID Requirement
children.description: caid must be set.

children.name: Parameter Requirements
children.description: apar must be non-set.

children.name: Asset Transfer Type
children.description: Asset Transfer

children.name: Base Type Definition
children.description: Is based on the Asset Transfer transaction type.

children.name: Field Requirements
children.description: snd, "receiver" (renamed from arcv) must be set.

children.name: Asset Opt-In Type
children.description: Asset Opt In

children.name: Base Type Definition
children.description: Is based on the Asset Transfer transaction type.

children.name: Asset ID Requirement
children.description: xaid must be set.

children.name: Address Requirements
children.description: snd and arcv must be set and equal to each other.

children.name: Amount Requirement
children.description: amt must be 0.

children.name: Asset Close-Out Type
children.description: Asset Close Out

children.name: Base Type Definition
children.description: Is based on the Asset Transfer transaction type.

children.name: Asset ID Requirement
children.description: xaid must be set.

children.name: Close Field Requirement
children.description: aclose must be set.

children.name: Asset Clawback Type
children.description: Asset Clawback

children.name: Base Type Definition
children.description: Is based on the Asset Transfer transaction type.

children.name: Clawback Target Requirement
children.description: clawbackTarget must be set.

children.name: Application Types
children.description: Application Call Abstracted Transaction Types

children.name: Application Creation Type
children.description: Application Create

children.name: Base Type Definition
children.description: Is based on the Application Call transaction type.

children.name: Application ID Requirement
children.description: apid must be non-set.

children.name: Program Requirements
children.description: apap, apsu, apgs, apls must be set.

children.name: Application Update Type
children.description: Application Update

children.name: Base Type Definition
children.description: Is based on the Application Call transaction type.

children.name: Action Number Requirement
children.description: apan must be set to 4.

children.name: Field Requirements
children.description: apid, apap, apsu must be set.

children.name: Application Deletion Type
children.description: Application Delete

children.name: Base Type Definition
children.description: Is based on the Application Call transaction type.

children.name: Action Number Requirement
children.description: apan must be set to 5.

children.name: Application ID Requirement
children.description: apid must be set.

children.name: Application Opt-In Type
children.description: Application Opt In

children.name: Base Type Definition
children.description: Is based on the Application Call transaction type.

children.name: Application ID Requirement
children.description: apid must be set.

children.name: Action Number Requirement
children.description: apan must be set to 1.

children.name: Application Close-Out Type
children.description: Application Close Out

children.name: Base Type Definition
children.description: Is based on the Application Call transaction type.

children.name: Application ID Requirement
children.description: apid must be set.

children.name: Action Number Requirement
children.description: apan must be set to 2.

children.name: Application Clear State Type
children.description: Application Clear State

children.name: Base Type Definition
children.description: Is based on the Application Call transaction type.

children.name: Application ID Requirement
children.description: apid must be set.

children.name: Action Number Requirement
children.description: apan must be set to 3.

children.name: Ledger Supply
children.description: Get the current supply reported by the ledger.

children.name: Block Information
children.description: Get the block information for the given round.

children.name: Block Hash
children.description: Get the block hash for the block on the given round.

children.name: Transactions IDs in Block
children.description: Get the top level transaction IDs for the block on the given round.

children.name: Transaction Proof
children.description: Get a proof for a transaction in a block.

children.name: Block Logs
children.description: Get all of the logs from outer and inner app calls in the given round

children.name: Light Block Header Proof
children.description: Gets a proof for a given light block header inside a state proof commitment

children.name: Block State Proof
children.description: Get a state proof that covers a given round

children.name: Account Observability
children.description: Get information regarding accounts

children.name: List Accounts
children.description: Search for accounts given a set of query parameters

children.name: Detailed Account information By Address
children.description: Given an account address, get all of the account information specified in the algod schema: https://developer.algorand.org/docs/rest-apis/algod/#account

children.name: Account Asset Holdings
children.description: Given an account address, get all of the assets the account is holding.

children.name: Account Asset Holding by Specific Asset
children.description: Get account's asset holding and asset parameters (if either exist) ,given a specific account public key and asset ID. The asset parameters should only be returned if the provided address is the asset's creator.

children.name: Account created Assets
children.description: Get all the account's created assets

children.name: Account Applications
children.description: Lists all of the applications created by the given account

children.name: Account Application by Specific Application ID
children.description: Given a specific account public key and application ID, get the application information

children.name: Asset Observability
children.description: Gets information regarding Assets

children.name: List Assets
children.description: Search for assets given a set of query parameters

children.name: Information by Asset ID
children.description: Given and asset Id, get all the information about that asset in the following schema: https://developer.algorand.org/docs/rest-apis/algod/#asset

children.name: Accounts that hold an asset
children.description: List of accounts who hold this asset

children.name: Transaction involving an asset
children.description: List transactions that involved the given asset id

children.name: Application Observability
children.description: Gets information regarding Applications

children.name: Application Information
children.description: Given a application ID, application information including creator, approval and clear programs, global and local schemas, and global state.

children.name: Get Application Boxes
children.description: Given an application ID, get all Box names.

children.name: Get Application Box Information
children.description: Given an application ID and box name, get round, box name, and value (each base64 encoded).

children.name: Get Application Logs
children.description: Get application log for a specific application ID

children.name: Transaction Observability
children.description: Get transaction information

children.name: List Transactions
children.description: Return a list of transactions given a set of params

children.name: Transaction Information By Id
children.description: Get information for single transactions by its ID

children.name: Transaction Parameters
children.description: Get parameters that help a client construct a new transaction.

children.name: Pending Transactions
children.description: Get information about pending transactions

children.name: All Pending Transactions
children.description: Get the list of pending transactions

children.name: Pending Transactions By ID
children.description: Get the transactions information of a recently submitted transaction, given a transaction ID.

children.name: Localnet
children.description: A system-wide set of containerized services working in concert to provide a local replica of the Algorand blockchain.

children.name: Localnet Management
children.description: Manages the use of the Localnet through commands like start and stop

children.name: Localnet Start
children.description: Start-ups localnet so that it's running algod, indexer and KMD

children.name: Localnet Stop
children.description: Stop all running processes related to localnet but does not clear the state information

children.name: Localnet Status
children.description: Get the status of all the containerized services that are running. The information should contain information about the blockchain state, node state, connection information (e.g. ports, schema), indexer state, KMD state.

children.name: Localnet reset
children.description: Resets localnet to the its original state (i.e. deletes all the blocks)

children.name: Localnet update to latest version
children.description: Updates the localnet containerize services to the latest container versions

children.name: Localnet detect older versions
children.description: Detects if the current localnet containers are not the latest version an prompts the user to the update the container versions.

children.name: Localnet configure container engine
children.description: Allows users to choose different container engines on which to run the containerize services, e.g. docker, podman

children.name: Global or project-based localnet
children.description: The ability to set a global localnet config (i.e. pinned versions for each service) or have particular pinned versions that vary by project. This would be something similar to global python installation vs virtual envs

children.name: Version configuration by project
children.description: The ability to customize the version of each of the services in localnet

children.name: Localnet interaction
children.description: Interact with localnet services to get awareness of nodes and blockchain data

children.name: Web-Browser based interactions
children.description: Can be inspected thru a web-browser application

children.name: CLI interaction with algod
children.description: Allows to iteract directly with the underlying algod containerized service

children.name: Localnet in a Web IDE
children.description: The ability to run localnet and its functions, including development in a Web IDE. The functionality for development will be determined the the functionality offered by the Web IDE

children.name: Localnet in Github Codespace
children.description: Must be able to run in Github codespaces

children.name: Node Information After Specific Block
children.description: Waits for a block to appear after round {round} and returns the node's status at the time. There is a 1 minute timeout, when reached the current status is returned regardless of whether or not it is the round after the given round.
